a.g: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muhammad], a clear conquest
That Allah may forgive for you what preceded of your sin and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path
And [that] Allah may aid you with a mighty victory.

It is He who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿ ليزدادوا إيمانا مع إيمانهم ﴾ وذلك بتأثير الطاعات في القلب وهذا لا يدركه إلا من راقب أحوال نفسه في أوقات المواظبة على العبادة والتجرد لها بحضور القلب مع أوقات الفتور وإدراك التفاوت في السكون إلى عقائد الإيمان في هذه الأحوال حتى يزيد عقده استعصاء على من يريد حله بالتشكيك بل من يعتقد في اليتيم معنى الرحمة إذا عمل بموجب اعتقاده فمسح رأسه وتلطف به أدركمن باطنه تأكيد الرحمة وتضاعفها بسبب العمل وكذلك معتقد التواضع إذا عمل بموجبه عملا مقبلا أو ساجدا لغيره أحس من قلبه بالتواضع عند إقدامه على الخدمة وهكذا جميع صفات القلب تصدر منها أعمال الجوارح ثم يعود أثر الأعمال عليها فيؤكدها ويزيدها.
Indeed, He, the Exalted, said: "That they may increase in faith [iman] with their faith [iman]." And that is through the effect of acts of obedience [ta'at] upon the heart [qalb]. And this is not perceived except by one who observes the states [ahwal] of his soul [nafs] during times of persistence in worship ['ibadah] and devotion to it with the presence [hudur] of the heart [qalb], compared to times of lassitude, and who perceives the disparity in the tranquility [sukun] towards the convictions ['aqa'id] of faith [iman] in these states, until his knot becomes more resistant to one who wishes to untie it through casting doubt. Rather, one who believes in his heart [qalb] the meaning of mercy [rahmah] towards the orphan, when he acts according to that belief by stroking his head and being gentle with him, perceives from his inner being [batin] a confirmation and multiplication of that mercy [rahmah] due to the action ['amal]. Likewise, one who holds the belief [i'tiqad] of humility [tawadu'], when he acts according to it by performing an act of bowing or prostrating to another, feels from his heart [qalb] the humility [tawadu'] upon his undertaking of service. And thus, all attributes [sifat] of the heart [qalb] issue forth actions [a'mal] from the limbs [jawarih], then the effect [athar] of the actions [a'mal] returns upon them, confirming them and increasing them.

a.g: [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment -

And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allah an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and Allah has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner
That you [people] may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor him and respect the Prophet and exalt Allah morning and afternoon.

Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allah - He will give him a great reward.

Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is Allah, with what you do, Acquainted.

But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."
And whoever has not believed in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.
And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of Allah. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allah say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.

Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit. So if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.

Certainly was Allah pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest
And much war booty which they will take. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.

Allah has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.
And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which Allah has already encompassed. And ever is Allah, over all things, competent.
And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.
[This is] the established way of Allah which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of Allah any change.
And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is Allah of what you do, Seeing.

They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that Allah might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى "إذ جعل الذين كفروا في قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجاهلية فأنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين" الآية. ذم الكفار بما تظاهروا به من الحمية الصادرة عن الغضب بالباطل، ومدح المؤمنين بما أنزل الله عليهم من السكينة
Indeed, when those who disbelieved placed in their hearts [qulub] the zeal [hamiyyah]—the zeal of ignorance [jahiliyyah]—then Allah sent down His tranquility [sakinah] upon His Messenger and upon the believers. (Verse 48:26) I censure the disbelievers for what they displayed of zeal [hamiyyah] emanating from anger for falsehood, and I praise the believers for what Allah sent down upon them of tranquility [sakinah].

a.g: Certainly has Allah showed to His Messenger the vision in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولما كانت الغشاوة منقشعة عن أعين الأنبياء عليهم السلام فلا جرم نظروا إلى الملكوت وشاهدوا عجائبه والموتي في عالم الملكوت فشاهدوهم وأخبروا، ومثل هذه المشاهدة لا مطمع فيها لغير الأنبياء والأولياء الذين تقرب درجتهم منهم إنما الممكن من أمثالنا مشاهدة أخرى ضعيفة إلا أنها أيضا مشاهدة نبوية وأعني بها المشاهدة في المنام وهي من أنوار النبوة. قال رسول الله ﭬ: (الرؤيا الصالحة جزء من ستة وأربعين جزءا من النبوة) وهو أيضا انكشاف لا يحصل إلا بانقشاع الغشاوة عن القلب فلذلك لا يوثق إلا برؤيا الرجل الصالح الصادق ومن كثر كذبه لم تصدق رؤياه ومن كثر فساده ومعاصيه أظلم قلبه فكان ما يراه أضغاث أحلام، ولذلك أمر رسول الله ﭬ بالطهارة عند النوم لينام طاهرا وهو إشارة إلى طهارة الباطن أيضا فهو الأصل وطهارة الظاهر بمنزلة التتمة والتكملة لها ومهما صفا الباطن انكشف في حدقة القلب ما سيكون في المستقبل كما انكشف دخول مكة لرسول الله ﭬ في النوم حتى نزل قوله تعالى: ﴿ لقد صدق الله ورسوله الرؤيا بالحق ﴾ {}[136]
Indeed, when the veil [ghishawah] is lifted from the eyes of the Prophets, peace be upon them, it is only fitting that they gaze upon the Dominion [malakoot] and witness its wonders. And the dead in the realm of the Dominion [malakoot], they witness them and inform. Such witnessing [mushahadah] is not attainable for any but the Prophets and the Friends [awliya'] whose station draws near to theirs. What is possible for the likes of us is another, weaker witnessing [mushahadah], yet it is also a prophetic witnessing [mushahadah], and I mean by it witnessing [mushahadah] in sleep, and it is from the lights [anwar] of Prophethood. The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The righteous vision [ru'ya] is one part of forty-six parts of Prophethood." And it is also an unveiling [inkishaf] that does not occur except by the lifting of the veil [ghishawah] from the heart [qalb]. Therefore, one only trusts the vision [ru'ya] of the righteous, truthful man. And whoever's lying increases, his vision [ru'ya] is not believed. And whoever's corruption and disobedience increase, his heart [qalb] becomes darkened, so what he sees becomes confused dreams. And for this reason, the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, commanded purity [taharah] upon sleeping, so that one sleeps in a state of purity [tahir], and it is an indication to the purity [taharah] of the inner [batin] as well, for it is the foundation, and the purity [taharah] of the outer [zahir] is in the position of a completion and perfection for it. Whenever the inner [batin] becomes clear, what will be in the future is unveiled in the pupil of the heart [qalb], just as the entry into Mecca was unveiled for the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, in sleep, until His word, the Exalted, was revealed: "Indeed, God has fulfilled His Messenger's vision [ru'ya] in truth."

a.g: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.

Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allah and [His] pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that Allah may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
و قد قال تعالى رحماء بينهم إشارة إلى الشفقة و الإكرام ومن تمام الشفقة أن لا ينفرد بطعام لذيذ أو بحضور في مسرة دونه بل يتنغض لفراقه ويستوحش بانفراده عن أخيه
Indeed, among its qualities is that he is deeply concerned [mushfiqan] for all the servants of God, merciful [rahiman] towards them, and severe [shadidan] upon all the enemies of God and upon everyone who commits anything of what He dislikes, as God Almighty has said: "Severe upon the disbelievers, merciful amongst themselves." And the blame of a blamer does not seize him, nor does any deterrent turn him away from anger for the sake of God. And with this, God described His allies [awliya'], when He said: Those who are tasked with My love [hubb] as a child is tasked with a thing, and they take refuge in My remembrance [dhikr] as an eagle takes refuge in its nest, and they become angry for the sake of My prohibitions [mahārim] as a tiger becomes angry when enraged, for he does not care whether people are few or many. So look at this example, for the child, when tasked with a thing, does not part from it at all, and if it is taken from him, he has no occupation except weeping and crying until it is returned to him. If he sleeps, he takes it with him in his clothes, and when he awakens, he returns and clings to it. Whenever he is parted from it, he weeps, and whenever he finds it, he laughs. Whoever disputes him for it, he dislikes him, and whoever gives it to him, he loves him. As for the tiger, he cannot control himself when angry, to the point that from the intensity of his anger, he destroys himself. These are the signs [alamat] of love [mahabbah]. So whoever is perfected in him these signs, his love [mahabbah] is perfected and his affection [hubb] is purified, so his drink [sharab] in the Hereafter [Akhirah] becomes pure and his watering place [mashrab] sweet. And whoever mixes with his love [hubb] love for other than God, he will enjoy bliss in the Hereafter [Akhirah] according to his love, for his drink [sharab] will be mixed with a measure of the drink of those brought near [al-muqarrabun], as God Almighty said concerning the righteous [al-abrar]: "Indeed, the righteous will be in bliss." Then He said: "They will be given to drink of a pure wine [rahiq] sealed, whose seal is musk – so for that let the competitors compete – and its mixture is of Tasnim, a spring from which those brought near [al-muqarrabun] drink." So the drink of the righteous [al-abrar] becomes pleasant due to the admixture of the pure drink [sharab al-sarf] which is for those brought near [al-muqarrabun].
